00025 #ifdef _UNICODE
00026 // If you comment the next "define" line then the library will never "switch to" _UNICODE (wchar_t*) mode (16/32 bits per characters).
00027 // This is useful when you get error messages like:
00028 //    'XMLNode::openFileHelper' : cannot convert parameter 2 from 'const char [5]' to 'const wchar_t *'
00029 // The _XMLWIDECHAR preprocessor variable force the XMLParser library into either utf16/32-mode (the proprocessor variable
00030 // must be defined) or utf8-mode(the pre-processor variable must be undefined).
00031 #define _XMLWIDECHAR
00032 #endif
00033 
00034 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(UNDER_CE) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(WIN64) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
00035 // comment the next line if you are under windows and the compiler is not Microsoft Visual Studio (6.0 or .NET)
00036 #define _XMLWINDOWS
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 #ifdef XMLDLLENTRY
00040 #undef XMLDLLENTRY
00041 #endif

00043 #ifdef _DLL_EXPORTS_

00045 #else
00046 #define XMLDLLENTRY __declspec(dllimport)
00047 #endif
00048 #else
00049 #define XMLDLLENTRY
00050 #endif
00051 
00052 // uncomment the next line if you want no support for wchar_t* (no need for the <wchar.h> or <tchar.h> libraries anymore to compile)
00053 //#define XML_NO_WIDE_CHAR
00054 
00055 #ifdef XML_NO_WIDE_CHAR
00056 #undef _XMLWINDOWS
00057 #undef _XMLWIDECHAR
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #ifdef _XMLWINDOWS
00061 #include <tchar.h>
00062 #else
00063 #define XMLDLLENTRY
00064 #ifndef XML_NO_WIDE_CHAR
00065 #include <wchar.h> // to have 'wcsrtombs' for ANSI version
00066                    // to have 'mbsrtowcs' for WIDECHAR version
00067 #endif
00068 #endif

00070 // Some common types for char set portable code
00071 #ifdef _XMLWIDECHAR
00072     #define _CXML(c) L ## c
00073     #define XMLCSTR const wchar_t *
00074     #define XMLSTR  wchar_t *
00075     #define XMLCHAR wchar_t
00076 #else
00077     #define _CXML(c) c
00078     #define XMLCSTR const char *
00079     #define XMLSTR  char *
00080     #define XMLCHAR char
00081 #endif

00482       typedef struct XMLNodeDataTag // to allow shallow copy and "intelligent/smart" pointers (automatic delete):
00483       {
00484           XMLCSTR                lpszName;        // Element name (=NULL if root)
00485           int                    nChild,          // Number of child nodes
00486                                  nText,           // Number of text fields
00487                                  nClear,          // Number of Clear fields (comments)
00488                                  nAttribute;      // Number of attributes
00489           char                   isDeclaration;   // Whether node is an XML declaration - '<?xml ?>'
00490           struct XMLNodeDataTag  *pParent;        // Pointer to parent element (=NULL if root)
00491           XMLNode                *pChild;         // Array of child nodes
00492           XMLCSTR                *pText;          // Array of text fields
00493           XMLClear               *pClear;         // Array of clear fields
00494           XMLAttribute           *pAttribute;     // Array of attributes
00495           int                    *pOrder;         // order of the child_nodes,text_fields,clear_fields
00496           int                    ref_count;       // for garbage collection (smart pointers)
00497       } XMLNodeData;
